content.para: The 3.9.0 release updates Lucene and other library dependencies, abandons Flash-based visualizations migrating to HTML5-only equivalents and provides an aggregate set of of bug fixes from previous minor releases.

td.p: Flash visualizations are gone from the Workbench and the web application, replaced by HTML5-based, shiny new visualizations from Carrot Search. This also means that Workbench and the webapp will require a modern browser for full functionality (IE9+, a recent version of Chrome or Firefox).

The update comes with a few minor improvements, such as multiple-cluster selection in the Web application (and the Workbench). Try it by selecting clusters while holding the the control (or the Mac) key.
Added basic preprocessing and associated lexical resources for Hindi.
This release includes over 25 bugfixes previously rolled out in minor bugfix revisions to 3.8.x line.

content.p: For a complete list of improvements and bug fixes, see JIRA
